text:
I have downloaded and installed the binary distribution 2.0.43 and am 
converting from 1.3.26(Windows version) to 2.0.43(Windows version). I have 
downloaded the win32 source for 2.0.43 and installed it. I have changed my 
1.3.26 code to use the 2.0.43 features but I can't link my module because the 
win32 libs are not included the distribution. Libs: libapr.lib, libaprutil.lib 
and libhttpd.lib are missing. The other win32 projects show them 
in: "..\..\srclib\apr\Release\libapr.lib" \, "..\..\srclib\apr-
util\Release\libaprutil.lib" \, and "..\..\Release\libhttpd.lib", however there 
is no "Release" directory or any libs with these names. In addition, there are 
not any build instructions to compile the 2.0.43 for windows. Can the win32 
version of these libraries be made available? If not, can I get the win32 build 
instructions so I can build the libraries?
creator: jay@photorola.com

text:
Choose custom, not 'default' installation.

  99.9% of win32 users never use /lib or /include, so they aren't installed
  on the default binaries installer.  Since you are .1%, choose custom, and
  add the 'build files' to your chosen files to install.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
